item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: More fly tipping at Havil street flats…, 30th January
item.description:
Fridge dumped again at Havil street flats. Happened between 7.30PM 29th January 2026 and 6.48AM 30th January 2026. Would be wise to look at prevention. Flats regularly targeted for fly tippers. Open lorry was at back of flats (Sedgemoor Place) late evening of 29th. Can’t be sure if them or happened in the night. Further fly tipping (bookshelf ) on the first floor.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on two lambeth steel bin containers outside residential flats 29 Bedwell house SW9 Brixton road., 30th January
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on two lambeth steel bin containers outside 29 Bedwell house residential flats. The graffiti wording spells Alice in green spray paint. The same culprit has also sprayed grafitti further along the main road which is very visible. The graffiti has recently been put there approximately a week. Please can these be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 332,334, Brixton Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parked lime bike, 30th January
item.description:
Dear Islington Council, I am a disabled resident living at 83 Corbyn Street, London N4 3BY, and have been living here since 2001. There is a designated disabled parking bay directly outside my property, which I rely on daily. Unfortunately, I have been experiencing ongoing problems with Lime bikes being left and parked illegally in this disabled bay. This issue has caused me significant stress and inconvenience, as I often have to ask passers-by for help to move the bikes before I can park in my space. I have reported this matter multiple times to both Lime directly and through FixMyStreet, but the problem persists. As this situation is now affecting my health and wellbeing, I kindly request that Islington Council intervene to help stop Lime bikes from being left in this bay. Possible actions might include: • Asking Lime to geofence or restrict parking in that specific bay; • Installing clearer signage or markings; or • Taking enforcement action where possible. Please let me know what steps the Council can take to resolve this matter. Thank you for your attention and understanding. Yours sincerely, Mustafa Yusuf 83 Corbyn Street London N4 3BY

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bryett Road, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Toxic construction fly tipping, 30th January
item.description:

item.title: Approximately 6 foot long pot hole outside 2/4 barnesdale crescent, 30th January
item.description:
This pot hole has been here for over 2 years. It always fills with water when it rains. Cars/vans have no choice but to drive through it soaking any unfortunate nearby pedestrians. And potentially damaging to vehicles wheels/rims.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Friar Road, Poverest, Greater London

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog litter continue after reports submitted, 30th January
item.description:
Despite Previous Reference no- 589336 were I reported on 22 Dec 25 dog littering and dumping poo bags being dumped behind the telecom box - resulting in we the residents cleaning it, this situation has continued. We requested for bins to be placed in the local area to negate this constant unpleasantness having to tidy after other people’s animals. Can you kindly address this with urgency reeducating the area that dog fouling has a penalty fine of up to £1000 by displaying posters everywhere and having enforcement officers where feasible, to enforce this. The individual/s are doing this deliberately because they know and can see the stickers we placed there to avoid this repeat offences.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
